ThingDef.description: A nice-looking collared shirt with buttons. A step up from the regular t-shirt.
ThingDef.label: kid button-down shirt

ThingDef.description: A child sized duster coat for blocking the sun and grit of the outdoors. Essential for any frontier deputy.
ThingDef.label: kid duster
kid jacket
ThingDef.description: A tough jacket to stop scrapes and bruises, and to keep one warm in chilly weather. A favorite of schoolyard bullies.

ThingDef.label: kid flak vest
ThingDef.description: A small vest with armor plates inserted on the chest and back. Popular among hussar cadets and warworld conscripts, if a child is wearing this, something has gone terribly wrong already.

ThingDef.label: kid flak pants
ThingDef.description: A small pair of pants with armor plates sewn in. Popular among military school cadets for both their comfort and protection, they are often flaunted as a status symbol.

ThingDef.label: kid flak jacket
ThingDef.description: A small yet tough fabric jacket with armor plates sewn in. While it's not as good as solid armor, it offers effective protection against raiders and opportunistic wargs while remaining quite comfortable.

ThingDef.label: kid marine armor
ThingDef.description: A child-sized suit of powered armor. Layered plasteel-weave plates are very effective at stopping attacks, with few vulnerable joint sections. Neuro-memetic assistors allow a human to wear the armor and still move easily.\n\nArmor like this is often worn by military cadets showing great potential.

ThingDef.label: kid recon armor
ThingDef.description: A suit of child-sized light partially-powered armor, designed to permit quick movement. Lightweight plasteel-weave plates block attacks without compromising mobility, and neuro-memetic assistors in the lower body allow a human to wear the armor and still move easily.\n\nArmor like this is often used by hussar-xenogerm candidates and glitterworld police cadets.

ThingDef.label: kid cape
ThingDef.description: A short cape of rough design. It appears to be a child's blanket, actually.

ThingDef.label: kid robe
ThingDef.description: A small, flowing robe without a hood.

ThingDef.label: kid eltex shirt
ThingDef.description: A small shirt embedded with special psychic focusing materials. These enhance psychic sensitivity and help dissipate neural heat. The fashionable choice among aspiring wizard apprentices.

ThingDef.label: kid eltex vest
ThingDef.description: A child-sized thin vest embedded with special psychic focusing materials. These enhance psychic sensitivity and help dissipate neural heat.
A small robe embedded with special psychic focusing materials. These enhance psychic sensitivity and help dissipate neural heat. Coveted among the elite psycasting apprentices in the empire.
ThingDef.label: kid eltex robe
kid prestige recon armor
ThingDef.description: A suit of child-sized light partially-powered armor, designed to permit quick movement. Plasteel-weave plates block attacks without compromising mobility, and neuro-memetic assistors in the lower body allow a human to wear the armor and still move easily.\n\nExpensive and beautiful, prestige armor like this is usually made for the children of highly ranked military officers. Embedded eltex threads also enhance the wearer's psychic sensitivity.

ThingDef.label: kid prestige marine armor
ThingDef.description: A suit of powered armor. Layered plasteel-weave plates are very effective at stopping attacks, with few vulnerable joint sections. Neuro-memetic assistors allow a human to wear the armor and still move easily.\n\nExpensive and beautiful, prestige armor like this is usually made for those destined to become high ranked military officers. Embedded eltex threads also enhance the wearer's psychic sensitivity.

ThingDef.label: kid cataphract armor
ThingDef.description: A suit of heavy powered armor, built for maximum protection at the cost of mobility. Heavy layered plasteel-weave plates with solid ablative coatings stop all but the most well-aimed or powerful attacks. Neuro-memetic assistors prevent the suit's massive weight from immobilizing the wearer entirely, but the suit is still quite cumbersome.\n\nCompletely impractical for any child to wear even if assigned to patrol their outpost, it is worn only in the most desperate emergencies.

ThingDef.label: kid prestige cataphract armor
ThingDef.description: A suit of heavy powered armor, built for maximum protection at the cost of mobility. Heavy layered plasteel-weave plates with solid ablative coatings stop all but the most well-aimed or powerful attacks. Neuro-memetic assistors prevent the suit's massive weight from immobilizing the wearer entirely, but the suit is still quite cumbersome.\n\nExpensive and beautiful, prestige armor like this is usually made for those of high status. Embedded eltex threads also enhance the wearer's psychic sensitivity. But even this does not prevent most from seeing it as an expensive joke.

ThingDef.label: kid locust armor
ThingDef.description: A variant of recon armor with an integrated burst rocket for short-ranged flight. Locust armor is slightly less protective than standard recon armor. Each jump consumes a burst of fuel, so the armor must be reloaded after several uses.\n\nUnlike most ultratech military units, locusts train primarily with melee weapons. These child-sized suits of armor are typically used to train fighting small animals, or to leap out of the way of a raiding party. It does not stand up to any extended fight, and is best utilized to position cadets behind the adults.

ThingDef.label: kid grenadier armor
ThingDef.description: A variant of marine armor with an integrated frag launcher on the shoulder. The armor is slightly less protective than standard marine armor. The launcher can only hold a limited amount of ammo and must be reloaded after use.\n\nCadets assigned this armor are typically enrolled near sites of mechanoid activity. It is not recommended for regular use, but can help children create an opportunity to escape a fight.

ThingDef.label: kid phoenix armor
ThingDef.description: A variant of cataphract armor with a shoulder-mounted flamebolt launcher. This armor is slightly less protective than standard cataphract armor against normal damage, but is especially flame-resistant. The flamebolt launcher has very limited ammo and must be reloaded after use.\n\nPhoenixes specialize in clearing out very confined spaces full of enemies, with training programs for cadets in this armor being more rigorous than most. They can absorb hits while moving down a corridor, fill rooms with flame, and emerge from the smoke unscathed.

ThingDef.label: kid mechlord suit
ThingDef.description: A child-sized power-assisted armor suit packed with mechanitor-assistance gear. The mechlord suit dramatically amplifies a mechanitor's bandwidth, but is somewhat less protective than dedicated heavy armor. Ideally, a child should not be commanding mechanoids.

ThingDef.label: kid heavy bandolier
ThingDef.description: A heavy shoulder-belt for keeping spare munitions close at hand. It allows quick access to bullets, grenades, arrows, or whatever the user needs, reducing their weapon's ranged cooldown. Due to its bulk, it can't be worn under other clothing. Children tend to pick up cool rocks or sticks and store them in the bandolier as well.

ThingDef.label: kid sash
ThingDef.description: A long strip of material worn over one shoulder. It offers minimal protection from heat, cold, and attacks. Popular among youth scouting organizations, children add badges and patches to mark their achievements.

ThingDef.label: kid lab coat
ThingDef.description: A knee-length overcoat worn over other clothing. While children are too young to conduct research, the lab coat helps them to focus on their studies.
